title: Authors and Citation
text: Jeremy VanderDoes. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. Lajos Horvath. Author. Lorenzo Trapani. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: VanderDoes J, Horvath L, Trapani L (2023). RCAmle: Find Change Points Random Coefficient Additive Models Order One Using Maximum Likelihood Estimation. R package version 1.0.1, https://jrvanderdoes.github.io/RCAmle/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RCAmle: Find Change Points in Random Coefficient Additive Models of Order One Using Maximum Likelihood Estimation},   author = {Jeremy VanderDoes and Lajos Horvath and Lorenzo Trapani},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.1},   url = {https://jrvanderdoes.github.io/RCAmle/}, }

what: Find Change Points in Random Coefficient Additive Models of Order One Using Maximum Likelihood Estimation
title: Find Change Points in Random Coefficient Additive Models of Order One Using Maximum Likelihood Estimation
text: package examining change point RCA(1) model. package related paper ‘maximally selected likelihood ratio test random coefficient models’. contains data code (written R) reproduce simulations, tables, figures paper. code used paper directly saved paperCode vignette. produced R 4.2.0 necessary external libraries loaded libraries section. function comments describing purpose function, inputs, outputs. data used analysis located related data folder–UK covid data US housing index data.

title: Find Change Points in Random Coefficient Additive Models of Order One Using Maximum Likelihood Estimation
text: can install development version RCAmle GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("jrvanderdoes/RCAmle")

title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate Indicator — MLEIndicator
text: Function  get MLE estimates data related cutoff.

title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate Indicator — MLEIndicator
code: MLEIndicator(   u,   y,   lower,   upper,   alpha = 0.05,   nStart = NA,   nEnd = NA,   returnEstims = FALSE,   estimVarLS = FALSE,   var1BaseEstim = 0.5,   var2BaseEstim = 0.5,   maxOptimIters = 2 )

title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate Indicator — MLEIndicator
text: u Vector numerics 4 parameters interest, c(b1,s1^2,s2^2,b2). initial estimate y Vector numerics data lower Vector numerics indicating lower bound.Variance negative third term must also 0. upper Vector numerics indicating upper bound. alpha (Optional) Numeric indicating significance interest. Default 0.05. nStart (Optional) Integer indicating starting point check data. Default results minimal trimming (4 params). nEnd (Optional) Integer indicating ending point check data. Default results minimal trimming (4 params). returnEstims (Optional) Boolean indicating estimated parameters returned. Default FALSE. estimVarLS (Optional) Boolean indicate use LS estimate var2. Default FALSE. var1BaseEstim (Optional) Numeric indicating base var1 estimate. Default 0.5. var2BaseEstim (Optional) Numeric indicating base var1 estimate. Default 0.5. May used estimVarLS. maxOptimIters (Optional) Numeric indicating number times re-try optimization. Can sometimes add get randomly odd result. Default 2.

title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate Indicator — MLEIndicator
text: Depends returnEstims true: List element 1 WLS estimates, element 2 MLE estimates, element 3 vector sqrt Tn estimate, cutoff, location max Tn, LNN. false: Vector sqrt Tn estimate, cutoff, loc max Tn.

title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate Indicator — MLEIndicator
code: data <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(0.5,1,0.25,-0.5), k=250, burnin=1000,                         iterations=500) MLEIndicator(c(0.4,0.9,0.1,-0.1), data, c(-Inf,0,10^-8,-Inf),              c(Inf,Inf,Inf,Inf)) #> [1]   7.843511   3.686173 250.000000

what: Maximum Liklihood Estimate with Finite Sample Approximation Indicator — MLEVostIndicator
title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate with Finite Sample Approximation Indicator — MLEVostIndicator
text: Function  get MLE estimates data related cutoff based finite sample approximation.

title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate with Finite Sample Approximation Indicator — MLEVostIndicator
code: MLEVostIndicator(   u,   y,   lower,   upper,   alpha = 0.05,   nStart = NA,   nEnd = NA,   returnEstims = FALSE,   estimVarLS = FALSE,   var1BaseEstim = 0.5,   var2BaseEstim = 0.5,   maxOptimIters = 2 )

title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate with Finite Sample Approximation Indicator — MLEVostIndicator
text: u Vector numerics 4 parameters interest, c(b1,s1^2,s2^2,b2). initial estimate y Vector numerics data lower Vector numerics indicating lower bound.Variance negative third term must also 0. upper Vector numerics indicating upper bound. alpha (Optional) Numeric indicating significance interest. Default 0.05. nStart (Optional) Integer indicating starting point check data. Default results minimal trimming (4 params). nEnd (Optional) Integer indicating ending point check data. Default results minimal trimming (4 params). returnEstims (Optional) Boolean indicating estimated parameters returned. Default FALSE. estimVarLS (Optional) Boolean indicate use LS estimate var2. Default FALSE. var1BaseEstim (Optional) Numeric indicating base var1 estimate. Default 0.5. var2BaseEstim (Optional) Numeric indicating base var1 estimate. Default 0.5. May used estimVarLS. maxOptimIters (Optional) Numeric indicating number times re-try optimization. Can sometimes add get randomly odd result. Default 2.

title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate with Finite Sample Approximation Indicator — MLEVostIndicator
text: Depends returnEstims true: List element 1 WLS estimates, element 2 MLE estimates, element 3 vector sqrt Tn estimate, cutoff, location max Tn, LNN. false: Vector sqrt Tn estimate, cutoff, loc max Tn.

title: Maximum Liklihood Estimate with Finite Sample Approximation Indicator — MLEVostIndicator
code: data <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(0.5,1,0.25,-0.5), k=250, burnin=1000,                         iterations=500) MLEVostIndicator(c(0.4,0.9,0.1,-0.1), data, c(-Inf,0,10^-8,-Inf),              c(Inf,Inf,Inf,Inf)) #> [1]   7.599452   3.261324 251.000000

title: UK Covid Data — UKcovid
text: Data showing hospitalisations four UK nations.

title: UK Covid Data — UKcovid
code: UKcovid

title: UK Covid Data — UKcovid
text: data frame 2614 rows 3 columns: nation Nation UK. options England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales. date Date cases Number reported hospitalisations

title: UK Covid Data — UKcovid
text: https://coronavirus.data.gov.uk/details/healthcare

what: Weighted Least Squares Estimate Indicator — WLSIndicator
title: Weighted Least Squares Estimate Indicator — WLSIndicator
text: function

title: Weighted Least Squares Estimate Indicator — WLSIndicator
code: WLSIndicator(y, N = length(y), alpha = 0.05, heteroWLS = FALSE, trim = log(N))

title: Weighted Least Squares Estimate Indicator — WLSIndicator
text: y Vector numerics data N (Optional) Integer indicating length data. Added speed increases. alpha (Optional) Numeric indicating significance interest. Default 0.05. heteroWLS (Optional) Boolean indicating data assumed hetereoskedastic . trim (Optional) Numeric indicating trim amount

title: Weighted Least Squares Estimate Indicator — WLSIndicator
text: Vector values estimate, cutoff, loc max

title: Weighted Least Squares Estimate Indicator — WLSIndicator
code: data <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(0.5,1,0.25,-0.5), k=250, burnin=1000,                         iterations=500) WLSIndicator(data) #> [1]   6.365446   3.686173 253.000000

what: Binary Segmentation for Change Point Detection — binarySegmentationCPDetection
title: Binary Segmentation for Change Point Detection — binarySegmentationCPDetection
text: function uses binary segmentation detect change points.

title: Binary Segmentation for Change Point Detection — binarySegmentationCPDetection
code: binarySegmentationCPDetection(   fullData,   method,   lower,   upper,   alpha,   estimVarLS = FALSE,   var1BaseEstim = 0.5,   var2BaseEstim = NA,   maxOptimIters = 1,   trimAmt = 4,   verifyCPs = TRUE,   silent = FALSE )

title: Binary Segmentation for Change Point Detection — binarySegmentationCPDetection
text: fullData Data.frame two columns. first date second values method String indicating method use change point detection. Options 'MLE', 'Vostrikova' , 'WLS'. lower Vector numerics indicating lower bound. Variance negative third term must also 0. upper Vector numerics indicating upper bound. alpha Numeric indicating significance interest. estimVarLS (Optional) Boolean indicate use LS estimate var2. Default FALSE. var1BaseEstim (Optional) Numeric indicating base var1 estimate. Default 0.5. var2BaseEstim (Optional) Numeric indicating base var1 estimate. Default NA. May used estimVarLS. maxOptimIters (Optional) Numeric indicating number times re-try optimization. Can sometimes add get randomly odd result. Default 1. trimAmt (Optional) Number indicating amount trim. Default 4. verifyCPs (Optional) Boolean indicating change points rechecked end. Default TRUE. silent (Optional) Boolean indicating output supressed. Default FALSE

title: Binary Segmentation for Change Point Detection — binarySegmentationCPDetection
text: Data.frame columns 'stDate' (start date region), 'enDate' (end date region), 'WLS_b1' (beta1 estimate using WLS), 'WLS_v1' (var1 estimate using WLS), 'WLS_v2' (var2 estimate using WLS), 'WLS_b2' (beta2 estimate using WLS), 'MLE_b1' (beta1 estimate using MLE), 'MLE_v1' (var1 estimate using MLE), 'MLE_v2' (var2 estimate using MLE), 'MLE_b2' (beta2 estimate using MLE).

title: Binary Segmentation for Change Point Detection — binarySegmentationCPDetection
code: data <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(0.5,1,0.25,-0.5), k=100, burnin=1000,                         iterations=200) data <- data.frame(1:length(data),data) binarySegmentationCPDetection(data,'Vostrikova',                               lower=c(-Inf,0,10^-8,-Inf),                               upper=c(Inf,Inf,Inf,Inf), alpha=0.05) #>  #> --Find CPs -- #> ChangePoint Detected (1-200 at 108): Segment Data and Re-Search #> ChangePoint Detected (109-200 at 166): Segment Data and Re-Search #>  #> -- Verify Step -- #> ChangePoint Detected (1-166 at 108): Segment Data and Re-Search #> ChangePoint Detected (109-200 at 166): Segment Data and Re-Search #>   stDate enDate     WLS_b1     WLS_v1    WLS_v2 WLS_b2     MLE_b1    MLE_v1 #> 1      1    108  0.4552255 0.09130864 9.7364025     NA  0.5382246 1.4036031 #> 2    109    166 -0.8129248 0.09404682 0.7525216     NA -0.8223713 0.1768376 #> 3    167    200  0.3034748 0.38723883 0.3947153     NA  0.2998389 0.4111160 #>      MLE_v2 MLE_b2 #> 1 0.2828231     NA #> 2 0.4842624     NA #> 3 0.3804947     NA

title: Compute 3 Methods — compute3Methods
text: function computes three methods (WLS, MLE, MLE_Vost). optimization improve speed calling three individual methods.

title: Compute 3 Methods — compute3Methods
code: compute3Methods(   u,   y,   lower = c(-Inf, 0, 10^-8, -Inf),   upper = c(Inf, Inf, Inf, Inf),   alpha = 0.05,   nStart = NA,   nEnd = NA,   returnEstims = FALSE,   heteroWLS = FALSE )

title: Compute 3 Methods — compute3Methods
text: u Vector numerics 4 parameters interest, c(b1,s1^2,s2^2,b2). initial estimate y Vector numerics data lower (Optional) Vector numerics indicating lower bound. Default c(-Inf,0,10^-8,-Inf). Variance negative third term must also 0. upper (Optional) Vector numerics indicating upper bound. Default maximal bound, c(Inf,Inf,Inf,Inf). alpha (Optional) Numeric indicating significance interest. Default 0.05. nStart (Optional) Integer indicating starting point check data. Default results minimal trimming (4 params). nEnd (Optional) Integer indicating ending point check data. Default results minimal trimming (4 params). returnEstims (Optional) Boolean indicating estimated parameters returned. Default FALSE. heteroWLS (Optional) Boolean indicating data hetereoskedastic. changes WLS estimation. Default FALSE.

title: Compute 3 Methods — compute3Methods
text: Depends returnEstims true: List element 1 WLS estimates, element 2 MLE estimates, element 3 false. false: Vector Tn estimate, WLS estimate, cutoff MLE/WLS, cutoff MLE_Vost, loc max Tn, loc max WLS.

what: Compute Amount of Data to Trim — computeTrim
title: Compute Amount of Data to Trim — computeTrim
text: just function control much trimmed

title: Compute Amount of Data to Trim — computeTrim
code: computeTrim(requireDrops, type, N = NA)

title: Compute Amount of Data to Trim — computeTrim
text: requireDrops Integer indicating number require dropped. Ensure least enough estimate parameters. NA, use log(N) trim (min 4) type String Start End. indicates start ending trim N (Optional) Integer length data. Needed type='End'

title: Compute Amount of Data to Trim — computeTrim
text: Numeric indicating index start/stop examining data

title: Compute Amount of Data to Trim — computeTrim
code: computeTrim(10,'Start') #> [1] 11 computeTrim(10,'End',100) #> [1] 90

what: Compute Weighted Least Square Values — computeWLSVals
title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values — computeWLSVals
text: uses weighted least squares estimate paramters RCA(1) changes. homoskedastic data. work replication done Horvath, Trapani 2022.

title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values — computeWLSVals
code: computeWLSVals(y, N = length(y), trim = log(N))

title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values — computeWLSVals
text: y Vector numerics data N (Optional) Numeric indicating length data. Included increase speed. Default length(y). trim (Optional) Numeric indicating trim amount. Default log(N).

title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values — computeWLSVals
text: Vector two values: value location max

title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values — computeWLSVals
code: data <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(0.5,1,0.25,-0.5), k=250, burnin=1000,                         iterations=500) computeWLSVals(data) #> [1]   6.180625 258.000000

what: Compute Weighted Least Square Values - Hetereoskedasticity — computeWLSVals_Hetero
title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values - Hetereoskedasticity — computeWLSVals_Hetero
text: uses weighted least squares estimate paramters RCA(1) changes. hetereoskedastic data. work replication done Horvath, Trapani 2022.

title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values - Hetereoskedasticity — computeWLSVals_Hetero
code: computeWLSVals_Hetero(y, N = length(y), trim = log(N))

title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values - Hetereoskedasticity — computeWLSVals_Hetero
text: y Vector numerics data N (Optional) Numeric indicating length data. Included increase speed. Default length(y). trim (Optional) Numeric indicating trim amount. Default log(N).

title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values - Hetereoskedasticity — computeWLSVals_Hetero
text: Vector two values: value location max

title: Compute Weighted Least Square Values - Hetereoskedasticity — computeWLSVals_Hetero
code: data <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(1.1,1,0.25,-0.5), k=500, burnin=1000,                          iterations=1000,                          par1HetereoLocation=100,                          par1HetereoMult=2) computeWLSVals(data) #> [1]  16.64109 500.00000

title: Generate Data — generateRCA1Data
text: function generates data according RCA(1) process.

title: Generate Data — generateRCA1Data
code: generateRCA1Data(   pars,   k,   burnin,   iterations,   errorType = "Normal",   stationarySims = 10000,   stationaryCutoff = -0.01,   par1HetereoLocation = NA,   par1HetereoMult = NA,   par2HetereoLocation = NA,   par2HetereoMult = NA,   silent = F )

title: Generate Data — generateRCA1Data
text: pars Vector parameters errors. format always similar, c(beta1, p1, p2, beta2); however, p1 p2 depend errorType. Errors always centered around 0 Normal: beta1, sigma1^2, sigma2^2, beta2 Bernoulli: beta1, prob1, prob2, beta2 Exponential: beta1, rate1, rate2, beta2 k Integer indicating point process change using beta1 using beta2 burnin Integer indicating number burnin iteration use iterations Integer indicating many observations final data . errorType String indicating type error. Options 'Normal', 'Bernoulli', 'Exponential'. stationarySims Integer indicating number simulations used check stationarity. stationaryCutoff Numeric indicating cutoff stationarity. Stationarity used determine burnin used. numeric can allow nonstationary regimes, jsut careful results blow . par1HetereoLocation (Optional) can used allow hetereoskedasticity par1 (2nd term pars) error. determines location . par1HetereoMult (Optional) can used allow hetereoskedasticity par1 (2nd term pars) error. determines amount multiply par1 . par2HetereoLocation (Optional) can used allow hetereoskedasticity par2 (3rd term pars) error. determines location . par2HetereoMult (Optional) can used allow hetereoskedasticity par2 (3rd term pars) error. determines amount multiply par2 . silent (Optional) Boolean indicating output requested

title: Generate Data — generateRCA1Data
text: Vector sequence RCA data length iterations according params

title: Generate Data — generateRCA1Data
code: data <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(0.5,1,0.25,-0.5), k=250, burnin=1000,                         iterations=500)  data1 <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(1.1,1,0.25,-0.5), k=250, burnin=1000,                          iterations=500)  data2 <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(1.1,1,0.25,-0.5), k=250, burnin=1000,                          iterations=500,                          par1HetereoLocation=100,                          par1HetereoMult=2)

title: Render Stacked Plot — renderStackedPlot
text: function renders stacked plot based data change points

title: Render Stacked Plot — renderStackedPlot
code: renderStackedPlot(trueData, parCPData, title, subtitle, varPlots = TRUE)

title: Render Stacked Plot — renderStackedPlot
text: trueData Data.frame data, first column date second column value parCPData Data.frame change points. First column start point, second column end point, third beta value, fourth variance1, fifth variance2. title String title plot subtitle String subtitle plot varPlots (Optional) Boolean indicate variance plots also built. Default TRUE.

title: Render Stacked Plot — renderStackedPlot
text: GGplot indicating data wiht change points, beta values, potentially variance values

title: Render Stacked Plot — renderStackedPlot
code: if (FALSE) { data <- UKcovid[UKcovid$nation=='Wales',c(2,3)] data <- data[order(data$date),] }  data <- generateRCA1Data(pars=c(0.5,1,0.25,-0.5),                          k=100, burnin=1000,                          iterations=200) data <- data.frame(1:length(data),data)  result_Vost <- binarySegmentationCPDetection(                        fullData=data,                        method='Vostrikova',                        lower=c(-Inf, 0, 10^-8, -Inf),                        upper=c(Inf, Inf, Inf, Inf),                        alpha=0.05,                        silent = TRUE) data_plot <- renderStackedPlot(trueData = data,                        parCPData = result_Vost[,c(1:2,7:10)],                        title = NULL, subtitle = NULL,                        varPlots = FALSE)

title: Simulate Power Curve — simulatePowerCurve
text: Simulate data, test change using 3 methods, plot power curve

title: Simulate Power Curve — simulatePowerCurve
code: simulatePowerCurve(   Us3,   U4s,   nSims,   lowerEst,   upperEst,   alpha,   burnin,   k,   N,   errorType = "Normal",   par1HetereoLocation = NA,   par1HetereoMult = NA,   par2HetereoLocation = NA,   par2HetereoMult = NA,   trimAmt = 4,   silent = FALSE )

title: Simulate Power Curve — simulatePowerCurve
text: Us3 Vector numerics indicating first 3 parameters U4s Vector numerics indicating 4th parameters (.e. multiple examine) nSims Integer indicating number simulations trial lowerEst Vector numerics indicating lower bound 4 parameters. Variance negative third term must also 0. upperEst Vector numerics indicating upper bound 4 parameters. alpha Numeric indicating significance interest. burnin Integer indicating number burnin iteration use k Integer indicating point process change using beta1 using beta2 N Integer indicating many observations final data . errorType (Optional) String indicating type error. Options 'Normal', 'Bernoulli', 'Exponential'. Default Normal. par1HetereoLocation (Optional) can used allow hetereoskedasticity par1 (2nd term pars) error. determines location . par1HetereoMult (Optional) can used allow hetereoskedasticity par1 (2nd term pars) error. determines amount multiply par1 . par2HetereoLocation (Optional) can used allow hetereoskedasticity par2 (3rd term pars) error. determines location . par2HetereoMult (Optional) can used allow hetereoskedasticity par2 (3rd term pars) error. determines amount multiply par2 . trimAmt (Optional) Numeric indicating amount trim. Default 4. silent (Optional) Boolean indicating progress output. Default FALSE

title: Simulate Power Curve — simulatePowerCurve
text: List two terms. Plot power curve Data.frame data used power curve

title: Simulate Power Curve — simulatePowerCurve
code: # Run more simulations typically U4seq <- 0.5 pc1 <- simulatePowerCurve(Us3 = c(0, 0.5, 0.5), U4s = U4seq,                   nSims = 10, lowerEst = c(-Inf,0,10^-8,-Inf),                   upperEst = rep(Inf,4), alpha = 0.05,                   burnin = 1000, k = 0.5 * 100, N = 100,                   errorType = 'Normal', silent=TRUE)

title: Simulate Stationary Region — simulateStationaryRegion
text: simulates draws RCA(1) stationary region

title: Simulate Stationary Region — simulateStationaryRegion
code: simulateStationaryRegion(   nSims = 10000,   addEdge = TRUE,   generationTrick = NA,   silent = F )

title: Simulate Stationary Region — simulateStationaryRegion
text: nSims (Optional) Integer indicating number simulations use point addEdge (Optional) Boolean indicating edge drawn generationTrick (Optional) String can indicate tricks improve running time. Default NA. NA: tricks, just run. take time theoretical: Rather generating normals, use quantiles get theoretical values reuse: Rather generating unique normals point, use one set memory: Uses complete matrix multiplication rather loops. fast, likely memory issues machines large nSims silent (Optional) Boolean indicating output suppressed (T). Default FALSE.

title: Simulate Stationary Region — simulateStationaryRegion
text: List data.frame date, (opt) data.frame edge information, ggplot2 plot.

what: Simulation Table with Null Case — simulationTable_NC
title: Simulation Table with Null Case — simulationTable_NC
text: function used generate table null rejection frequencies

title: Simulation Table with Null Case — simulationTable_NC
code: simulationTable_NC(   betas,   varProbRates,   nSims,   iterations,   burnin,   lowerEstim,   upperEstim,   alpha,   errorTypes,   CPLoc = 0.5,   seed = NA,   silent = F,   trimAmt = 4 )

title: Simulation Table with Null Case — simulationTable_NC
text: betas Vector numerics indicating betas examine (remember null case one beta used iteration) varProbRates Vector 2 values indicating variance probabilitise used parameters, c(u2, u3). nSims Integer indicating number simulations trial iterations Integer indicating many observations final data . burnin Integer indicating number burnin iteration use lowerEstim Vector numerics indicating lower bound 4 parameters. Variance negative third term must also 0. upperEstim Vector numerics indicating upper bound 4 parameters. alpha Numeric indicating significance interest. errorTypes Vector indicating errorTypes investigate. Options 'Normal', 'Bernoulli', 'Exponential'. CPLoc Numeric indicating change point location, 0 1. seed (Optional) Integer indicate seed set interation. Default NA sets seed. silent (Optional) Boolean indicating progress output. Default FALSE trimAmt (Optional) Number indicating amount trim. Default 4.

title: Simulation Table with Null Case — simulationTable_NC
text: Data.frame null rejection frequencies

title: Simulation Table with Null Case — simulationTable_NC
code: data_er <- simulationTable_NC(betas = c(0.5),                               varProbRates = c(0.5, 0.5),                               nSims=5, iterations = c(50),                               burnin = 1000, lowerEst=c(-Inf,0,10^-8,-Inf),                               upperEst=c(Inf,Inf,Inf,Inf), alpha = 0.05,                               errorTypes = c('Normal'),                               CPLoc=0.5) #> ErrorType: Normal (1/1) #> - Starting Beta: 0.5 (1/1) #> -- Running Iters: 50 (1/1)  if (FALSE) { data_er <- simulationTable_NC(betas = c(0.5,0.75,1,1.05),                               varProbRates = c(0.5, 0.5),                               nSims=500, iterations = c(100, 200, 400, 800),                               burnin = 1000, lowerEst=c(-Inf,0,10^-8,-Inf),                               upperEst=c(Inf,Inf,Inf,Inf), alpha = 0.05,                               errorTypes = c('Normal','Bernoulli','Exponential'),                               CPLoc=0.5, seed=1234) }
